I lost one of my closest friends who was a Washington DC Metro police 
officer.  We both went into the military at the same time, went to boot 
camp together, trained at Eglin and then at Coronado for DDT, and then 
served in Afghanistan together.  We were both EOD techs in the Air Force. 
 We disarmed IED's for a living.  After we got out he became a police 
officer and just before his one year of service he was shot and killed.

He was responding to a call regarding domestic violence and the suspect was 
very hostile.  My friend repeatedly told him to get down on the ground and 
put his hands behind his head but the suspect refused.  My friend did not 
pull out his gun.  The suspect went after the officer and after they 
wrestled on the ground for a while, the suspect grabbed his gun and shot 
and killed my officer friend.  

The officer was white, the suspect was black.

Eyewitnesses said that the officer pulled out his gun and shot first, but 
there were only two bullets missing from the clip and those two bullets 
were in my dead friend's chest.  There were also fingerprints of the 
suspect all over the gun and none from the officer. The eyewitnesses 
clearly lied.
